channel.title: Projects on My Website
channel.description: Recent content in Projects on My Website

item.title: Project 1: Exploratory Data Analysis
item.description: Data Wrangling and Data Exploration 1. Introduction The first dataset I chose for my exploratory data analysis was state.x77, renamed State. It contains 50 observations for each U.S. state and includes data for each state. Those variables include population, income per capita, illiteracy, life expectancy, murder rates, high school graduation percentage, frost or mean days with a temperature below freezing, and area.

item.title: Project 2: Modeling, Testing, and Predicting
item.description: 0. Introduction Melanoma <- read_csv("Melanoma.csv") ??Melanoma Melanoma$sex[Melanoma$sex=="1"] <- "Male" Melanoma$sex[Melanoma$sex=="0"] <- "Female" Melanoma$status[Melanoma$status=="1"] <- "Dead" Melanoma$status[Melanoma$status=="2"] <- "Alive" Melanoma$status[Melanoma$status=="3"] <- "Other causes" The dataset Melanoma has 205 observations on patients in Denmark with malignant melanoma. There are 7 variables, 4 of which are numeric, 3 are categorical, and 2 of those 3 are binary. The variables include survival time measured in days, sex depicted as male(1) or female(0), age in years, the year of operation, tumor thickness in mm, and ulcer depicted as present(1) or absent(0).
